qas.question: What type of grammar was phonology first a part of?
What is the name of ancient Sanskrit grammar?
During what time period did Panini do his work?
What other text was related to the Ashtadhyayi?
What type of grammar were phenomes first a part of?
What is the name of ancient phenome grammar?
Who first composed the Sanskrit language?
During what time period did the Sanskrit language begin?
What other text was related to morphology?

context: The history of phonology may be traced back to the <a1_0><b6_0>Ashtadhyayi<b6_0/><a1_0/>, the <a0_0><b5_0>Sanskrit<b5_0/><a0_0/> grammar composed by <a2_0><b7_0>Pāṇini<b7_0/><a2_0/> in the <a3_0><b8_0>4th century BC<b8_0/><a3_0/>. In particular <a4_0><b9_0>the Shiva Sutras<b9_0/><a4_0/>, an auxiliary text to the Ashtadhyayi, introduces what can be considered a list of the phonemes of the Sanskrit language, with a notational system for them that is used throughout the main text, which deals with matters of morphology, syntax and semantics.
